body.p: Born in Centreville, Livingston County, Kentucky on January 15, 1812. Married Elizabeth Eaver in 1830. Graduated at the Kentucky School of Medicine. In 1833, moved to Ramsey, Kentucky to practice medicine. Moved to Fredonia, Kentucky in 1844. Moved to Marion, Kentucky 1848. Was instrumental in treating the "milk sickness" in Kentucky. Moved to Southland, Kentucky 1853. Moved to Paducah, Kentucky 1856. Commissioned as an officer in Company S, Confederate States Medical Staff Infantry Regiment in the Confederate Army as Surgeon in 1861. Moved to Atlanta, Georgia 1862.Served a surgeon to Albert Sidney Johnson after Fort Donelson. Was the field surgeon for Cleburne's division at the Battle of Murfreesboro, Tennessee. Medical director of Hardee's command. In March of 1864, he was elected to the provisional council of the confederate government in Kentucky, but claimed after the war to have never served in that capacity. Died on May 18, 1886 at Atlanta, Georgia.
